meanings.definition: A person who advocates or practices exclusion.
meanings.sent1: The exclusionists in the group wanted to keep others out of their club.
meanings.sent2: The exclusionists at the meeting voted to restrict access to the event.
meanings.sent3: The exclusionists decided to have a party only for themselves, excluding everyone else.
meanings.sent4: The exclusionists built a high wall around their property, symbolizing their desire to keep others away.
meanings.sent5: The exclusionists wore special badges to identify themselves as part of the exclusive group.

meanings.definition: Those who believe in excluding certain individuals or groups from a particular activity or society.
meanings.sent1: The exclusionists argued that only a select few should be allowed to participate.
meanings.sent2: The exclusionists enforced strict rules to keep out those they deemed unworthy.
meanings.sent3: The exclusionists joked about forming a secret club with a 'no outsiders' policy.
meanings.sent4: The exclusionists' actions spoke louder than words, showing their commitment to keeping others out.
meanings.sent5: The exclusionists' exclusive party was the talk of the town, with many feeling left out.
